post.description:
This endpoint handles all ingestion of data into the system, including enrolments, impressions and conversions.

> warn
> Participants may only be enrolled into a running experiment.

experiment.description: The key of the experiment to enroll in.

variant.description: The key of the variant to enroll the participant into.

participant.description: The key of the participant to enroll. The participant will automatically be created if it does not yet exist.

event.description: The key of the event that converted. Only required during a conversion.

force.description: Whether to force the enrollment. By default, if the participant is already enrolled in the experiment, the enrollment will be ignored. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The ID of the team.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relationships to include in the response.

schema.description: Comma-separated list of relationships to include in the response.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to paginate by. Defaults to 15.

schema.description: The number of results to paginate by. Defaults to 15.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field to sort by. Defaults to 'id'.

schema.description: Field to sort by. Defaults to 'id'.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields to filter the attributes to.

schema.description: List of fields to filter the attributes to.

key.description: The key to use for the variant. Must match the regex /^[a-z0-9]+(?:_[a-z0-9]+)*$/i. Must not be greater than 255 characters.

control.description: Whether the variant is the control.

traffic.description: The amount of traffic the variant should receive. This is only needed if the experiment is using Weighted Variants. Must be at least 0 characters. Must not be greater than 100 characters.

x-topics.title: Rate Limits
x-topics.content: We limit API requests to 2,000 requests per hour. If you need an increased rate limit, please contact us.

x-topics.title: Checkmango Documentation
x-topics.content: This webpage refers to Checkmango's API documentation. If you're looking for documentation on Checkmango, you should visit the [Documentation](https://docs.checkmango.com).

x-topics.title: Troubleshooting
x-topics.content: If you run into any problems using Checkmango's API, please do not hesitate to contact our support team at support@checkmango.com.
